commit.message:
fix output of UTF-8 characters in limited locales

When the locale is limited (for example LC_ALL="C") and any output has
special characters, bugz fails. Fix it by forcing utf-8 encoding for the
output. This forcing works for python 3.7 and onwards. Not perfect, but
considering EOL of python versions, this already covers most of the
versions.

Closes: https://bugs.gentoo.org/604826
Signed-off-by: Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org>

verification.payload:
tree b70b9597df8bc5ad6adafcf1154a0851f5505ec3
parent 6a0a96756c7eaa99a3fa8a4d3059ac952362ea28
author Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org> 1709309730 +0200
committer Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org> 1709309730 +0200

fix output of UTF-8 characters in limited locales

When the locale is limited (for example LC_ALL="C") and any output has
special characters, bugz fails. Fix it by forcing utf-8 encoding for the
output. This forcing works for python 3.7 and onwards. Not perfect, but
considering EOL of python versions, this already covers most of the
versions.

Closes: https://bugs.gentoo.org/604826
Signed-off-by: Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org>

commit.message:
change build system to flit

For simple python only projects, flit is the best choice. It is simple,
has a very stable API (unlike setuptools), and is very easy to use.

Also simplify the data installation by using flit's data_files, so now
install man pages, bash/zsh completions and pybugz.d files are installed
where is needed in "share" directory.

Add contributors from hidden documentation inside code into main place:
pyproject.toml

Specify we require python 3.3 at least at the metadata level.

Signed-off-by: Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org>

verification.payload:
tree 2f3dc3ba06492bdcebe76968c0880417cc72c7f2
parent 0b14ac88479a988af1b241d924965ea71803617e
author Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org> 1709232756 +0200
committer Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org> 1709233572 +0200

change build system to flit

For simple python only projects, flit is the best choice. It is simple,
has a very stable API (unlike setuptools), and is very easy to use.

Also simplify the data installation by using flit's data_files, so now
install man pages, bash/zsh completions and pybugz.d files are installed
where is needed in "share" directory.

Add contributors from hidden documentation inside code into main place:
pyproject.toml

Specify we require python 3.3 at least at the metadata level.

Signed-off-by: Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org>

commit.message:
utils: use builtin way to get terminal width

`shutil.get_terminal_size` is available in Python 3.3 and later, and is
exactly what we need here. I'm unsure from where `win32utils` come from,
but there is no import for it or something, so it can't work.

I've verified `shutil.get_terminal_size` implementation on unix and it
does the same we did before, only better - so I see only gains from this
replace.

Resolves: https://github.com/williamh/pybugz/issues/114

verification.payload:
tree be1714e2bbbbf3542423e328ecf75695216958a8
parent 93ac59cffd97e305a5df936309b590d9a8f809bf
author Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org> 1709228256 +0200
committer Arthur Zamarin <arthurzam@gentoo.org> 1709228634 +0200

utils: use builtin way to get terminal width

`shutil.get_terminal_size` is available in Python 3.3 and later, and is
exactly what we need here. I'm unsure from where `win32utils` come from,
but there is no import for it or something, so it can't work.

I've verified `shutil.get_terminal_size` implementation on unix and it
does the same we did before, only better - so I see only gains from this
replace.

Resolves: https://github.com/williamh/pybugz/issues/114

commit.message:
add support for searching for addresses in CC field

Note from William:
This is not documented in Bugzilla's search API, so I don't really know
whether it is stable or not.

man: Update the "SEE ALSO" section to include the other man pages

This adds bugz(1) to pybugz.d(5) and vice versa.
This fixes #100.

Add --interactive command line switch for username and password prompts

This switch allows you to decide whether or not  to be prompted for a
username and password if no credentials are configured for the bugzilla
you are using.

The default setting is not to prompt, which will mean that pybugz will
access bugzilla in read-only mode if no credentials are configured.
version 0.14

Catch xml.parsers.expat.ExpatError exception

This is related to #83. It does not solve the issue, but it prevents the
stack trace until I can find a better fix.

Add option to allow skipping validation of ssl certificates

This is for #44.
setup.py: add documentation and examples
move global definitions to a separate module
add configuration for LLVM bugzilla
get: hide cc_detail field
version 0.13

configs: define search_statuses individually for each Bugzilla

This seems to make more sense than defining search_statuses globally,
especially since we may support bug trackers other than Bugzilla in the
future.
Add configuration for BusyBox Bugzilla

modify: add --unassign flag

Return the bug to the default owner (e.g. when you give up on a bug)

note by williamh: I changed the dest= parameter in the command line
parser to reset_assigned_to to match bugzilla's parameter.

This fixes #93
get: skip the assigned_to_detail and creator_detail fields

search: standardize command line and config file parameter for statuses

Before this commit, we were using search_statuses for the configuration
file setting and status for the command line argument to set the search
statuses to pass to Bugzilla. Now we use search_statuses in both and
pass it to Bugzilla as status.

Add configuration for FreeBSD Bugzilla

This fixes #86.

Make search_statuses in configuration files comma separated

This is related to #86.

Add estimated_time, remaining_time, work_time and deadline to modify command

This fixes #97.
flake8 fixes

configfile: fix traceback on interpolation syntax error

We need to catch the configparser.InterpolationSyntaxError exception so
we do not cause a traceback when the interpolation character is not used
correctly.

This fixes #90.

Add a message directing users away from tokens

Since Bugzilla has deprecated tokens, we need to move users away from
them to either an API key or passing their usernames and passwords to
Bugzilla.

This is related to #91.
Add API key support
